result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas M Benish was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Cases called at 1:13 p.m.: 15CF418, 16CF59, 16CM153, 16CF274. 15TR4619,  Defendant Thomas M Benish in court, in custody with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to counts 1 in 16CF59 & 15CF418. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence to prison for 3 years in each case consisting of 1 year confinement, 2 yrs. Extended Supervision,  Conds: Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations. Submit DNA sample. $518 costs in 15CF418, $268 costs in 16CF59. In 16CF59, count 2 dismissed.  In 15CF418, ct. 2 read in and dismissed. 15CF418 consecutive to 16CF59. 16CM153 & 16CF274 read in and dismissed. 15TR4619, not guilty entered, to be set for trial.  Court read in and dismissed 16CM153 & 16CF274. Defendant is eligible for Earned Early Release and Challenge Academy. Jail credit to be determined.  Court adjourned at 1:31 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 7, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
